resources.string: Asset audit will be completed by %1$s
User %1$s is not authorized to perform asset audits
Asset audits must be authorized
This audit was created with custom parameters
This audit definition was created on %s. %s
This will be the first audit completed using this definition.
The last audit completed using this definition was on %s.
Your equipment manager has selected for this audit to be blind. You will not be shown a list of remaining audits.

Begin the audit by scanning an asset\'s tag. Continue scanning assets until there are no more left to scan. You can add additional notes to each asset if desired. Once all assets have been scanned submit your audit.
During this audit you will be looking for the following asset models: %s.
During this audit you will be looking for every asset model. This includes: %s.
Custom Audit
You should expect to find assets of every status during this audit.
During this audit you should expect to find assets with the following statuses: %s.
Welcome to
Additional information on the current audit is available
Assets that have not yet been audited are listed below. Continue scanning assets until no more remain
After scanning an asset you may add additional notes for each asset
Once you have finished scanning all assets you may submit your results
Select a pre-made audit from the list. This audit will define the asset models and statuses that are expected to be found during the audit.
Your equipment manager has disabled custom audits.
Tap the edit button to add additional notes to each audited asset. These notes will be included in the audit report sent to your equipment manager.
Please wait %d seconds to continue
User authentication not required
Unknown user (userID: %d)
Custom audit
Blind audit
This asset was not expected to be found during this audit.
This asset is tagged with a status of %s, but you were only expected to find assets tagged as %s.
This audit was only expected to cover assets that are %s. This asset is %s.
currently assigned to a user
currently assigned to %s
not assigned to anyone
You can add this asset to the audit if desired.
